Study 1 Methods: "We measured physiognomic beliefs for sociability, morality, and competence with the physiognomic belief scale (Jaeger et al., 2020)."
The authors note that "physiognomic beliefs for sociability, morality, and competence" were obtained "with the physiognomic belief scale (Jaeger et al., 2020)."
They add that "we also measured general physiognomic belief... with three questions" that form the general version of the Physiognomic Belief Scale.
